meanings.definition: tired or bored, typically after having had too much of something
meanings.sent1: After watching so many movies in a row, I felt jaded and needed a break.
meanings.sent2: She became jaded with the same routine every day.
meanings.sent3: The jaded cat yawned at the sight of yet another mouse.
meanings.sent4: His jaded mind was like a worn-out book with faded pages.
meanings.sent5: The jaded student struggled to stay awake during the lecture.

meanings.definition: worn out or dulled by overuse or excessive indulgence
meanings.sent1: The jaded old shoes could no longer keep up with his active lifestyle.
meanings.sent2: The once vibrant painting now looked jaded from years of exposure to sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The jaded remote control refused to change the channel no matter how many times he pressed the button.
meanings.sent4: Her jaded taste buds could barely distinguish the flavors of the overcooked meal.
meanings.sent5: The jaded engine sputtered and coughed, signaling it was time for a tune-up.
